stories.text:
This is one of the craziest stories from my user interviews.

Last week, I was talking to one of our users to get feedback on our idea & product.

She was an UI/UX designer at a well-known start-up. She joined the start-up 8 months back.

She said, “I was the most junior member in my team, so my manager asked me to take notes of our daily catch-up meetings and share notes with others”. Initially, she kind of enjoyed taking notes but after a couple of months, she felt undervalued.

She mentioned, “It was like I’m not the part of team discussion, couldn’t share my ideas or views since I was busy taking notes.”

One day she confronted her manager and shared her views. His manager said I used to take notes in my early days too. What’s an issue?

She said, “I couldn’t take it anymore and started applying to other companies”. Last month she joined another start-up.

Luckily, an intern takes notes for everyone here. She said, “I shared instaminutes.com with him as soon as I got to know about it. I don’t want him to face the same situation as I did.”

To be honest, I didn’t know that we are helping people to this extent with Instaminutes.

Please like and share if you think a person should be given the chance to work as per their area of interest not something they don’t like doing, for e.g., taking meeting notes.

Please share your story in comment if you faced any similar situation.
stories.title: I quit my job because my boss asked me to take meeting notes
